resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The temple of Hathor is the major monument of the religious complex of Dendera. It is dedicated to Hathor, goddess of love, motherhood, music and joy. Although older remains have been found, the construction of the current temple began in 54 BC and is completed under the reign of the Roman emperor Augustus. The realization of the decorations of the temple continued throughout the Roman period. The cult of the magician goddess Isis replaced Hathor and is very popular in Roman society. That can explain why inside the temple of Hathor were find the cartouches of several Roman emperors such as Augustus, Tiberius, Caligula, Claudius and Nero. This cultural appropriation demonstrates the importance of appropriating certain symbols to achieve power.
resource.chars: The temple of Hathor is the major monument of the religious complex of Dendera. It is dedicated to Hathor, goddess of love, motherhood, music and joy. Although older remains have been found, the construction of the current temple began in 54 BC and is completed under the reign of the Roman emperor Augustus. The realization of the decorations of the temple continued throughout the Roman period. The cult of the magician goddess Isis replaced Hathor and is very popular in Roman society. That can explain why inside the temple of Hathor were find the cartouches of several Roman emperors such as Augustus, Tiberius, Caligula, Claudius and Nero. This cultural appropriation demonstrates the importance of appropriating certain symbols to achieve power.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: <span style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; text-align: justify;">The beautiful paintings, made from lapis lazuli, were made by the candles of the Christians who took refuge there to flee the persecutions of the Romans.
resource.chars: The beautiful paintings, made from lapis lazuli, were made by the candles of the Christians who took refuge there to flee the persecutions of the Romans.
